description: All about the food: the sushi is really fresh. The miso soup is really tasty and fresh. I would have hoped for more seaweed. The deep fry chicken was too peppery, would have prefer it less peppery. Would definitely try the rolls and the house creation next time!
author: Lena W.

description: Works of art that are unbelievably fresh and delicious! Some of the best nigiri and sushi I have ever eaten. I was also quite stunned at the amazing presentation and care given to each of the dishes. Highly recommended.
author: Steven K.

description: Perfection. From the sashimi to the waghu beef. Everything was perfection. The sashimi I with a plum sauce was sour and sweet, while the beef steak with a teriyaki fried Claris sauce was sweet and oh so yummy. Definitely coming back here again.
author: Knastayyy M.

description: Fresh food, wonderful services, great ambiances. I have really enjoyed my lunch there.
author: Samantha L.

description:
I suppose if you are in a bind, (no access to Uber/Lyft, you just torn a hamstring or broke a leg, or something else limiting your mobility, but you still have your credit card), this is an okay place to eat since there isn't much in that area of SOMA. If you have options though, go somewhere else.  

The service is okay.  There was someone there to take our order, get us the check, but no check in's. I am not high maintenance, so that's enough services for me.  
The menu is huge and confusing. They cover rolls, sashimi, entrees, a bunch of random apps.  Nothing about this place is what you'd exactly think of as Izakaya.  I am skeptical of places with huge menus. It's a small kitchen and you can't do everything well. The menu screams of a restaurant that's trying too hard.

The food was average at best.  We got the Wasabi Salmon, fried crawfish, age dashi tofu, beef tendon (just to be a little adventurous) and some sake. Salmon and sake were good, the rest were in the C+ range.  
 
This place is also surprisingly expensive. It really is on the low end of the $$$ range. This was not a lot of food and cost a bit over $80.
author: John S.

description: I've been here twice with very big groups. We requested the private room in the back, which is SO much fun. The waiters are amazing - they are extremely attentive, patient, and fun despite having to deal with very large, very loud, and very needy groups. I would absolutely come again for the back room. The wagyu beef is melt-in-your-mouth amazing and they have a great sake selection!
author: Tandra L.

description:
This place was great. The hosts were kind and the food was top notch in both taste and presentation. You can't leave the place without trying out the wagyu beef. I've tried a lot of places that claim to serve wagyu, but nothing came close to this. Highly recommend. 

It's a nice and cozy place, but a bit small so you might have to wait on busier nights. I believe you can make reservations for the rooms in the back so if you have a large party I'd go with that.
author: Phillip G.

description:
There was a bit of waiting time but the food was def worth the wait.  Pork Belly was juicy and tender.  Spicy Chicken Wings were finger licking good.  Their Spicy Yu-ke Tuna was surprisingly tasty and flavorful.  The stand out dish had to be the Stone Burning Wagyu Beef.  We will definitely be back for more!

Our waitress Zoe was amazing.  She really made our dining experience delightful!
author: Ray C.

description: Our new favorite sushi in soma! Very unique and tasty rolls. We tried dancing all night roll which was AMAZING! Definitely will go back!
author: Nahal S.

description: This is a $ ambiance restaurant with $$ quality food with $$$$ prices. Entree for $21.50 came with 4 pieces that was mostly badly cut cucumber and no memorable taste. After spending $60 I had to go to another place for dinner. They're trying to bank on downtown location assuming all techies are fools when it comes to food
author: Deepa G.

description: Zen Izakaya is an awesome Japanese restaurant in San Francisco in a good SoMa location. Their rolls depart slightly from the sushi house standard in a refreshing manner. Waitstaff did a nice job attending to our table. We also enjoyed a large amount of complementary beer, which I suspect will not be the case in the future but was welcome nonetheless. We will likely return in the future at perhaps a once per year frequency.
author: Geoffrey Y.

description: We came here before 6pm on a weekend as we were in the area. Just had a 5 minute wait for table for 2 though the place was smallish and crowded. Food was great but very pricey. Couldn't help but re-order the beef tendons which were very more-ish. Tako wasabi's my other love and it was on point here.
author: Lindt C.

description: Came here last minute with some friends visiting and got the private room with Ricky serving, had the best time food was amazing and Ricky was helpful af. Came here a second time with coworkers and booked the private room again ...omg food is amazing (A5 wagyu and more) and Felix kept us hecka drunk.... I'm lit as we speak omw home and love this place!
author: Michael E.

description: Great sushi.  Service is a bit rough.  Front of the house needs more training, but I still recommend it.  Maguro and Salmon were both some of the best I've had, and "The Scallops" were fantastic.
author: Kitty W.

description: All in all a great Japanese restaurant in SOMA. Especially love the lunch bento boxes, but there are a limited number so it pays to go early for these.
author: Anthony W.

description: Fantastic dinner at Zen! All the food was wonderful, Asparagas, Edamome, super rolls. Many sake choices and great service. Can't wait to go again!
author: Liz W.

description: I came in for their grab-and-go bento advertised on their website, they also had a sign showing the same items . Not a SINGLE one listed was offered today, instead they had a spam masibi (spelling ?) and vegitable fry (whatever that is). Their regular menu items were super pricey... feels like the classic bait and switch to me. I will not be coming back.
author: Mair S.

description: Great new neighborhood place where you can always get a table. Not sure why it doesn't get more traffic because it has better food than other Japanese restaurants in the area.  Good happy hour specials and nice presentation.
author: C T.

description: I'm always excited when a new neighborhood Japanese restaurant opens up! The rolls were a bit overpriced for what they were, but still delicious. The real gem is their spicy fried chicken wings. They were so damn good that we ordered a second plate. $10 for a good size portion. I don't think this sport will be my go to for a quick and simple sushi meal, as their menu is geared towards fusion style plates. Still highly recommend you try it!
author: Mileen Z.

description: Came here with my mom and sister for dinner. It was super yummy. Portions are bigger than normal and happy hour from 5-6:30pm is sooo good! Our server was so sweet too! My mom knocked over her water glass and they were so nice when cleaning it up. Food is delicious!! Tried Shochu for the first time and it was really good! Highly recommend the Mango!
author: Emily M.

description: I just ate there for the first time, and had a fantastic lunch. The service was wonderful and the food was so fresh and delicious. I've worked at 3rd & Townsend for a long time now, there are not too many sushi places around this neighborhood ( I am over the over-priced awful Nama Sushi on King Street!) so I was very happy to find this place. Prices are ok, but if you want to spend a little more, and have a fantastic, healthy meal with great service then save your pennies, this place is worth it!
author: Coco F.

description: We recently moved to SF and live in the neighborhood and stopped in to check it out. Prices were kind of high but food was excellent. The Wagyu beef was delicious. Decor is kind of plain but I guess nice for an Izakaya style restaurant and seating is comfortable. It was nice to have a Japanese server which made the experience more authentic. We didn't get the rolls but will get that next time because they did look pretty good.
author: Liz W.

description: The food is tasty and the quality is great but I wouldn't go back for the steep prices. I think it should be $$$ rather than $$. We had the ankimo, the beef tongue pot pie, burdock root salad and pepper tail. Bill comes to around $90. Also it's not what I'd expect for an izakaya. Guess it's more tailored to an American style Japanese restaurant with sushi rolls, udon, and nigiri offered as well as some izakaya style elements with small appetizers.
author: Godzilla C.

description: The food is just weird. I've been here twice. Disappointed both times. Random flavors that just don't go together well.
author: Nors P.

description: Service is great, staff is very professional, and the food is to die for. I'm gonna be a regular here. Try the steak!
author: Albert R.

description: Great sushi place. Has fresh oysters, a great sake/wine/beer menu, and great service. Miso soup and uni were excellent.
author: Mardo M.

description: Great food and great drinks. Our service was prompt and the prices seemed reasonable for the quality of the food. I'll definitely be going here again.
author: Adam B.

description: This restaurant's boss has creative mind on cooking Japanese food. He adds a little bit of local style on  traditional Japanese which attract more and more local people come in. Good taste! !
author: Monica Y.

description: It's awesome to have a solid local sushi place in the neighborhood. Something mid SOMA was really lacking.
author: Yahoo T.

description: The food is okay - a bit overpriced. We saw a hair in garlic edamame and the waiter took it back to the kitchen to replace with a new dish and took it off the bill. In addition, the place has poor vent and I kept coughing when I first sat down. The neighborhood really needs a good Japanese restaurant and too bad this one isn't quite the one...
author: Ruth W.

description: Def not a 4.5 star place. Very limited and not very exciting lunch menu. Got the spicy sashimi salad don. They don't tell you what fish is in it, depends on whatever is fresh they said. More like whatever is left over :( most of the fish were not good... Mushy fish, kind of gross.
author: Angela Z.

description: The server was new and did not give us the full menu, so we had to order from a very limited menu. The food was overpriced given its poor quality. Would not recommend.
author: J T.

description: Delicious food with lots of interesting flavours. The service was great. A bit pricey in my opinion for the amount of food. The restaurant desperately needs better ventilation, though. We left with our clothes stinking of fish and grilled wagyu meat from the neighbouring tables. I had to wash all my clothes as soon as I got home.
author: John M.
